name: Rachel McDaniel
text:
Selling our home through Listed it Myself was by far the best home selling experience we’ve had. They were very knowledgeable and professional and we were under contract for a full price offer just 24 hrs after listing!

Bobby’s photography of our house in our listing was exceptional! We attribute the number of showings to his amazing photos.

I highly recommend using ListeditMyself to buy or sell your next home!

name: Will Payne
text: Very easy process to list your home. I answered a few questions and they took care of the rest of it. Very professional service from signage to photos. Would definitely recommend.

name: Yevonne Pearce
text: I highly recommend using Listed It Myself, if you are considering selling your home yourself. The key is to get your home on the MLS system. I have used this service twice and have had great success. In 2015, I used Listed It Myself and my home sold in approximately one week. This year (2019), my rental property sold in one day and over asking price. I highly recommend Bobby and his team. Thank you again!

resp.text: Thank you Yevonne for your repeat business.  We are so happy we were able to help you again, and we very much appreciate you sending your family and friends to us as well.  Thanks again, and please let us know if we can help you in any way in the future!

name: Dustin Williams
text: Highly recommend. We had our house listed FSBO for a month before listing with Bobby and Christy. After listing with them we had an offer within a couple of days. Great value considering the quality of photos Bobby takes, getting your house in the MLS, and the assistance they provide along the way. We’ll definitely use again!

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our service, Dustin!  And we were so happy we were able to help jump the sale of your home!  Best of luck in the future, and remember, when it comes time to BUY your next home, we can save you money on that end as well!  Thanks again!

name: Lori King-Taylor M.Ed.
text:
We listed our home on Listed It myself and don't regret it one bit.  If your are going to go the For Sale by Owner route, you must enlist Listed It Myself! Bobby was very helpful throughout the entire process and our home sold quickly.  I know that I could not have sold it as quickly without them.  The very small investment was worth it's price in gold!

The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because you don't have someone actively out there pushing your home to clients like you would if you went the realtor route, but then there is a big price to pay when you do enlist a realty service.

I would definitely use Listed it Myself again in the future!

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review Lori!  Congratulations on your full-price, cash sale!  Please let us know if we can ever help you again in the future!

name: Lisa Cole
text:
I can’t say enough about how happy I am with Listed It Myself and Bobby DeHaye! It is a fantastic business concept Huntsville is fortunate to have. It’s for anyone wanting to have a little control over their house showings or hoping to save some money. Selling by owner can be complicated and draining but Bobby is a tremendous realtor who will support you through the process.

We signed up online and he contacted me within 24 hrs to schedule a photo shoot for the listing. The pictures were outstanding!!! We chose the MLS option which also included Zillow. We had an incredible turnout for an open house a couple of days later and ended up with several offers (some above the listed price)!

You can opt to pay an additional percentage and he will represent the buyer and seller if no realtors are involved. I highly recommend this option! He is honest, unbiased and looks out for both parties.

Again, I highly recommend Listed It Myself!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Lisa!  You and Mike had spent so much time and effort making your home look so fantastic, you definitely deserved to keep more of your money!  I'm glad we were able to help you get it sold!  Congratulations, and best of luck in your new home!

name: Daniel Rodriguez
text: Next time I sell a house, I will definitely be using them again! They handled everything professionally and went out of their way to make sure my wife and I were informed on everything we needed to know. Exceptional company and service! Recommend them to anyone and everyone who decides to sell by owner.

name: Mary Beth Key
text: I highly recommend Listed it Myself. Our family has used Bobby 3 TIMES!!! You know if you keep going back, it must be good! We recommend Listed it Myself to all of our friends. A great value for the service you are given. Bobby was very responsive, his pictures were very high quality, and we sold all 3 houses in less than a week!!!

resp.text: We were so happy to be able to help you two again! It is an amazing thing to have such great, repeat customers! Congratulations, and let us know if we can ever help again in the future!!!

name: Patty Bohan
text: Bobby and Christy were amazing to work with, they went above and beyond all expectation.  They helped us with the sale of our old home, and with the purchase of our new home. We won't  ever make a real estate move without them in the future.  Hire them, you will be so happy you did.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experiences of using our services here for everyone to read.  We are very glad we were able to help you sell your house and get into your new home. Please let us know if we can ever help you again in the future. You were an absolute pleasure to work for.

name: Ann Perkins
text:
My husband and I listed two properties, a home and a cabin, with Listed It Myself. We wanted an alternative to the usual way of selling property. Bobby DeHaye took fabulous photos of both properties to post on the LIM
website and was extremely helpful answering our questions along the way.
Listed It Myself prepared all the paperwork for the sales agreement and all we had to do was sign it! I have recommended Listed It Myself to several  friends and neighbors. It is nice to have an alternative method of selling property somewhere between FISBO and paying a full service realtor.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking the time to review our company Ann!  We are glad we were able to help with your house in Huntsville and in Fort Payne!  You and Gerry were great to work with, and Christy and I wish you two the best of luck up North and out West!

name: Joseph Sasso
text:
We decided to use the Listed It Myself (LIM) service after seeing how quickly another home in our neighborhood sold using LIM.  We selected the level of service that included MLS listing to ensure maximum exposure.  That became the source for all the showings in the short time that the home was on the market.

What surprised us most about Listed It Myself was the level of service and involvement in the marketing, sale negotiation, and follow-on activities up to closing.  We had thought that we would have to handle most of that ourselves.  From the very professional pictures taken for the LIM and MLS listings to interactions with other realtors, Bobby DeHaye provided outstanding service and communications while saving us thousands.  Thank you, Bobby.

resp.text: Thank you Joe, and congratulations on selling your home above asking price!!!  This is going to sound very cliche, but your review makes a great point...we definitely try our very hardest to exceed our customers' expectations.  I am very glad we were able to do that for you on this home!  Congratulations again, and please let us know if we can ever help you again in the future with selling (or buying) another home!

name: Lisa Cole
text:
I can’t say enough about how happy I am with Listed It Myself and Bobby DeHaye! It is a fantastic business concept Huntsville is fortunate to have. It’s for anyone wanting to have a little control over their house showings or hoping to save some money. Selling by owner can be complicated and draining but Bobby is a tremendous realtor who will support you through the process.

We signed up online and he contacted me within 24 hrs to schedule a photo shoot for the listing. The pictures were outstanding!!! We chose the MLS option which also included Zillow. We had an incredible turnout for an open house a couple of days later and ended up with several offers (some above the listed price)!

You can opt to pay an additional percentage and he will represent the buyer and seller if no realtors are involved. I highly recommend this option! He is honest, unbiased and looks out for both parties.

Again, I highly recommend Listed It Myself!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Lisa!  You and Mike had spent so much time and effort making your home look so fantastic, you definitely deserved to keep more of your money!  I'm glad we were able to help you get it sold!  Congratulations, and best of luck in your new home!

name: Nitashia Harris
text: Houses are not available..dont waste your money!!!!!!

resp.text:
Hello Nitashia Harris.  A quick google search finds that you are a newly licensed real estate agent here in Huntsville, and therefore a competitor of our business.  In fact, you are brokered by a company I do many successful deals with every year.  I find it quite troubling that you would try to damage our reputation when my wife and I have worked so hard to build and maintain a 5-star rating over the course of the past 8 years.  We have helped hundreds of local homeowners sell their homes, and collectively saved them hundreds of thousands of dollars in traditional real estate commissions.  Our actual customers absolutely love the service we offer.  And in fact, the agents that we personally interact with also appreciate our promptness and professionalism.  Lastly, I would point out that your leaving a review on a competitor's company is a direct violation of the NAR's Code of Ethics...from NAR..."REALTORS® do not attempt to gain any unfair advantage over their competitors; and they refrain from making unsolicited comments about other practitioners."
Due to the obvious conflict of interest of being a competitor, we respectfully request that you remove this review.  If not, I'm sure people reading it will fully understand what is going on, and we wish you the best of luck on your future endeavors.

name: Amber Brookman
text: Bobby and Christy were great help in selling our house and getting a fair price in a complicated comparison situation. We were very happy with their Full Service option!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to share your success story!  We wish you the best of luck in the new house!

name: Jessica Wortman
text: Could not have had a better experience using Listed It Myself! We used the full service option and sold our house in just 2 weeks! We saved thousands and still had many of the benefits of having a realtor. I highly recommend this service to anyone looking to sell their home!

resp.text: Thank you very much Jessica!  I'm glad we were able to help you and Chase get your home sold and save a bunch of money!  Best of luck to you in the future!

name: Barbara DeHaye
text: Great people to work with. Always available to answer questions. Very helpful in the sale of my family home!

name: Brad Bohan
text: Bobby and Christy DeHaye have earned our highest recommendation and appreciation.  They absolutely exceeded our expectations.  We used the full service option for both buying our new home and selling our previous.  Bobby went above and beyond to ensure we were taken care of throughout the whole purchasing process; from finding our house, working with agents, inspectors and contractors to guiding us through the complicated paperwork. Our selling experience was even better.  Through his network of real-estate agents, Bobby was able to find a buyer for our home prior to us listing it on MLS.  We closed on our house within a week and saved thousands of dollars.  We’ve used agents from other national realtor companies in the past but none have come close to providing the level of service and support we received from the DeHayes.

resp.text: Thank you so much Brad.  You and Patty were awesome to work with.  Christy and I are glad we were able to help on both ends!  Please let us know if we can ever be of assistance again in the future!

name: Matt Henslee
text: We just completed the sale of our first home through ListedItMyself and would seriously recommend this method to anyone looking to sell! The savings simply cannot be beat for the relatively small amount of work required to get your home listed, shown and sold through this service. Bobby is very responsive, his team is professional and the MLS gives you all the exposure you need to sell your home quickly.

resp.text: Glad we were able to help Matt!  Congratulations, best of luck, and let us know if we can ever help you again in the future!

text: Thanks Tracie for getting my condo sold in less than 30 days on the market!  I work in the title business, but it’s different when you are on the “other side” of a contract. text: After our home was for sale for over a year with Coldwell Banker, we decided to go with RaJane. Thank God we did...she sold our home in less than 2 weeks! I try my best to be impartial, but she stands in my top five favorites. Five stars is the most i can give, but i'd like to do better. name: Callie Finney
text: I am exceptionally pleased with the service, guidance, and professionalism Mrs. Wilder displayed during the process of selling and purchasing a home - in the middle of a pandemic, no less! She gets to know clients on a personal level and due to that, she knew that wasn't the home for us. I knew she had multiple clients, but we were always made to feel like we were the only ones. She was attentive and discerning. Even after the sale, she has stayed in touch to ensure our first few weeks are running smoothly and we are getting settled in. I could not have asked for a better realtor. Mrs. Wilder is the best for a reason. If you are in need of a realtor, I encourage everyone to trust her. She will always be my first call, with no hesitation. Thank you for making this process and the next chapter in my and my husband's lives one to remember!

name: Zalex
text:
(Review for Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter)

When we first moved to Birmingham from Orlando FL due to work relocation, we struggled to find a realtor who showed us the time of day and weren’t able to find good reliable homes for rent or purchase. Once we were seriously in the market, we were referred to Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter by our Regions bank loan guy and it was one of the best things that had ever happened to us. Rosalie helped us through the entire home buying experience step by step, she showed genuine care and concern in the houses we looked at and offered very productive and valuable tips for us. The fact that she was so reliable was amazing, but the best part was her consistency in being responsive to any of our questions or concerns, even late at night or early mornings. We want to thank Rosalie from the bottom of our hearts for all she did for us and HIGHLY RECOMMEND her to any future home buyers. Her and her family are always welcome in our house anytime. :)

-The Garrett’s

name: Mary Baxter
text: Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter was so professional and responsive! Before I could even think of the next step, she was already on top of it and making calls, giving us resources and contacts, etc. I felt like every single thing was taken care of throughout the whole process and it all went so smoothly. She definitely has her clients' best interests at heart and will do what it takes to make them happy. We are so grateful.

name: Lindsey Barnett
text:
We love Rosalie Pribbenow Baxter! As first-time home buyers, my husband and I knew nothing about looking for a home and I mean NOTHING. I think the first time I called her I frantically said, "I need a realtor, I don't know anything about buying a house, and I've already made a big mistake, can you please help me?!" (I had made an appointment to see a house with a seller's realtor on my own) and she was so patient with me and helpful amidst my rambling. She immediately fixed my snafu and we hit it off from there.

Rosalie made home-buying feel easy and understandable. She was flexible and available whenever we wanted to see homes and gave us many great options to tour based on our criteria. She was great at communicating with us regularly and making sure we understood the process. Once we found the perfect home, she handled the rest and walked us through every step smoothly.

I think the best thing about Rosalie is she is a professional who will make you feel secure and taken care of while also being genuine and real. She will be honest with you about a home and your options and she understands that home-buying is a process that is crazy and takes time, especially when juggling work and family. She is the best!

name: sally weller
text: My husband and I just closed on our new home in Hoover last week.  Rosalie Baxter made the whole process totally stress free.  She is so knowledgeable and a real pleasure to work with.  We feel confident that we got the best house for us at the best price.  She is a total pro and I am so happy that she was our realtor.  I highly recommend her.

name: Cathy Giles
text: We loved working with Cici, she is a true professional. She was patient, understanding, and very accommodating.  Every call or text was answered promptly. name: Adam T
text: I don’t recommend ARC Realty. The realtor Donna G. Was very unprofessional. Didn’t show the house just sat on the couch while we showed the house ourselves. And that the sellers want to only work with a “professional realtor and agent”. She then said “she is an added value” for the seller. I later found out the biggest question was the house in a flood zone...she said maybe I don’t know. Goes to show the flood rating was an 8/10 zone. Very moderate. Don’t work with ARC Realty. They don’t add anything. Just hungry for commission. Definitely working with a for sale by owner now.

I highly recommend Sarah to help sell or find your new home. Our family was so grateful to have had her in our corner during this stressful process, and we are loving life in our new home.

name: Brett Woodward
text:
CiCi at ARC Realty is spectacular!!

Everything we needed to learn and understand as first time home buyers she walked us through step by step. CiCi made herself available  whenever we had a question or whenever it fit our schedule to view a new home. While working with her it was always clear that she had our best interest at heart and that she wanted to find the right home for us just as much as we did.  Her knowledge of the home buying process was exceptional. She was a mini home inspector as we walked through each home, helped us understand the timeline the home buying process, provide us with tons of professional contacts, and gave us reassurance and comfort, and support whenever needed! She was there every step of the way!

Just as important as helping us find a home, CiCi took the time to get to know us as a family. She may us feel like we were going through the home buying process with someone we had known our whole lives!

If we ever decide to sell and/or buy another home one day, CiCi will be the one and only realtor we call!

We can not be anymore thankful and appreciative to CiCi for helping us find a home and would more than recommend her to anyone looking for a spectacular person and realtor to work with!

name: Lawson Porter
text:
I could write an entire novel about how impressed I am with ARC Realty agents Haley May and Leda Mims, but I will condense it for your convenience.

My wife and I put our house up for sale in Cullman, AL in April of 2019. After a bad experience with the previous realty company, mostly due to poor communication, we parted ways and came upon Haley and Leda.

Throughout the entire process, we received advice, updates, and plans to make the house more appeasable to the market. After wasting 5 months during the prime selling season with our prior company, Haley and Leda put together a game plan and sold our house in 2 short months in a difficult season for sellers!

They made it easy, painless, and actually enjoyable! Go see these ladies and I promise you will not be disappointed, as a buyer or seller. They were a Godsend to us. I know they will not let you down!!!

Thanks ladies, you have my utmost respect and I wish you NOTHING but the best in life!

name: Gaba1503
text:
TO KEEP WITH THE CONVERSATION ABOUT THE SEPTIC TANK:

I very well know ARC Realty is not a septic tank company BUT you are basically saying that you hire shady subcontractors that do bad jobs? I would expect you guys have reliable service providers that you can trust...

Very bad experience with a broker from ARC Realty.
After buying a house, previously agreeing in the signed contract that the septic tank pump was going to be replaced, we had overflowing issues, consequently bad smell and other issues. We found out with a licensed septic tank specialist that the pump installed by the so-called broker’s “licensed specialist” was really a cheap pump, too small to pump properly which cost us the amount of $3250 to replace. This is a prime example of how a broker can be deceitful to sell a house at the loss of the buyer and the gain of the seller; so buyers be aware

DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ARC!

text: Words can't even describe how WONDERFUL  our experience was. My husband and I purchased our first home this month. We used Pam Files as our realtor and Cindy Morrison for the lending process. Hands down, Cindy blew that rumor out of the water. This super woman had us ready to close in less than a month! Cindy works really hard and really fast to get the job done. It was as easy as pie lol. And Pam, this woman is so sweet and lovely but, don't let that fool you. She can get tough if need be to get the job done. We had issues with our builders making MANY mistakes and dragging out the closing date. Pam wouldn't let up on them till they got the job done right! Pam was so caring during the hunt for our home and helped us through the entire process. She was there to answer our questions whenever we had them. She has a great eye for detail and noticed things I never would have noticed when looking at homes. She really took notice to what I like and what I was looking for in a home. She read my personality well. We finally found the home of our dreams (a french country spec home). We were not expecting to deal with problems from the building company but we did. As soon as problems started to arise I thought I would become extremely stressed out but Pam stepped in and handled everything. I am truly thankful for everything Pam and Cindy did for us. I can't wait to get our house settled and decorated so I can invite these two ladies to our home warming party. We would not be in such a lovely home had it not been for these two wonderful ladies holding our hands through the entire process. Thank you so much Pam and Cindy!!! You two are like family to us now. I will definitely recommend you guys to everyone I know who is looking to buy a house or refinance. <3

We provide equal housing opportunities to all people, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, handicap, familial status, national origin, sexual orientation or gender identity. If this happens, our staff are empowered to warn the caller about any abusive language used before disconnecting the call. Our president, Chip Watts, is available to discuss this or any other issues you or any other viewers of this review may have. His direct line is 205-703-4277.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

text: Thought I found a great property but took forever to get stuff fixed and now that I have moved, they are siding with the landlord to try and get me to pay for stuff that I am not responsible for. name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

text: I'd give a negative star rating if the option was available! Customers beware!  EXIT realty in Gulf Shores is a JOKE!!! My husband and I rented a home for 1 year from them and the entire process was a nightmare.  The day we arrived our house was a disaster,  even though they were expecting us. There were paint cans every where,outlet covers were missing AND there were containers of rat poison sitting around. Needless to say we had to get a hotel the first night...fast forward to plumbing and HVAC issues that took a week each to get fixed until we moved out, no one showed up to do a walk through with us and then, a month after moving out, we were told they were keeping our deposit of $950 because of a couple crayon marks on the wall and 2 new toilet seats that had come unhinged...the moral of my story is they have poor customer service, they're dishonest and not dependable.  You have to follow up numerous times to get an issue resolved.  Judy who works there is rude and unprofessional. I was charged  $950 for literally a couple crayon marks, we don't live in poor conditions, it was normal marks from living in our home. I will never rent or purchase a home through EXIT realty again.

name: Jeff Lean
text:
We were extremely disappointed in our experience with Exit Realty and agent Tommy Stanton.  Being a former Realtor myself in Tennessee, I'm aware of the responsibility an agent has to their client.  When we hired Mr. Stanton, we were pleased with his feedback and demeanor.  As time passed the feedback, both from his weekly calls stopping and the review emails from the property viewings, slowed down significantly, however we would still consider it satisfactory.  Throughout listing our property with Mr. Stanton, we provided him with all of the information he requested.  However, 36 hours from closing, we were told that we would have to pay our property pool assessment to the tune of $4700.  It was our understanding this would be assumed by the new buyers.  At first he said that he didn't want to go around and around if we told him or not (which we did upon hiring him), but he was aware of our other assessment, so the logic of knowing one but not the other makes no sense.  As I stated in an email to him, even if we pretend that we didn't pass along the information, he's presented himself as one of the most knowledgable and successful agents in the area with lot of experience at the Gulf Shores Plantation.  How would an expert agent who does business there all the time, not be aware to ask about an assessment that began a year and a half ago, which all units there had.  He then proceeded to tell us that he checked on it and the assessment was non-transferrable and could not be assumed by the buyer, which we double checked with our HOA and that was untrue.  We had to pay it because our agent didn't negotiate that on our behalf in the contract.  We gave him a grace period to do something to make it right and were basically told that it just was what it was.  Instead, Mr. Stanton tried to force the situation/closing like everything was common practice.  Had any effort been shown to correct this or any financial responsibility whatsoever been taken, we absolutely wouldn't have posted reviews on every website we could.  As we indicated to the company before closing, with this not happening, we felt like we needed to let our HOA, others rental services and the general public know our experience with Mr. Stanton and Exit Realty.

One of their brokers/owners stepped in to call us to see what could be done and apologized repeatedly, saying he believed it was an honest mistake and that it has changed how they will do things in the future.  He said on all future transactions, they will have a disclosure form for things like assessments.  First, I am shocked that's not already common practice as I know in Tennessee everything has a disclosure.  Second, I am glad that this error may have changed how Exit Realty does business, but it was at $4700 of my expense.  We hope this helps anyone who is looking to list or buy in the future and will assist you in assuring the same thing doesn't happen to anyone else

text:
Carin Charles and her team were fantastic.  I would use Carin for all of my real estate transactions.  She helped me and my family purchase a home in Hoover when we moved in 2014 and she was with us every step of the way when we sold it in 2019.
As a buyer's agent she provided expert guidance on the area and real estate market.  She also provided expert recommendations on making offers and negotiating with the seller.  She helped us secure a home in a relatively short timeline and manage a closing with difficult sellers.  We were even able to negotiate a new roof with the seller because of Carin's expertise and contacts within the area.
As a selling agent she was with us providing guidance on prepping the home well before we put it on the market.  She was able to guide us on improvements and repairs that would be needed in the home prior to placing the home for sale.  Additionally, through her and her agency we were able to secure fantastic photos of the home and expert advertising in MLS, typical real estate web sites and an enhanced social media campaign.  We were able to get the home under contract quickly and sold with absolutely no hiccups.
Carin and her team are top notch and I would recommend them for any of your real estate needs.

Chris Vail is an awesome realtor! Very professional with unsurpassed knowledge of the area. As a representative for us as a seller, Chris did a fantastic job negotiating on our behalf and was very astute in contract detail when buyers agent attempted to include uniquely worded requests.

As representative for us as a buyer, he works just as keenly and hard in locating the best value for our family. He is always available, and considerate, to answer even the most trivial questions or concerns.

We would highly recommend Chris to any buyer/seller of either single family or multi-residential properties in our area. We will never have the need to search out another realtor as long as Chris is in Orange Beach.

text: I double paid and would like to get a refund. Nobody picks up and you have to leave a message. Nobody calls back.

name: Andrew Scarborough
text: As part of our HOA Board I experienced firsthand, this company’s consistently bad communication(not answering emails), inattentive management style, and disrespect from the owner of this company.  We often had to wonder who was managing who, because basic issues that should be easily addressed required repeated follow-up with you to make sure it got done.  For example, one of our condo owners had to actually drive to the post office to pick up their mail for close to two months because mail carriers would no longer deliver mail to a box that had no door and we couldn’t get this company to address getting the mailbox replaced in a timely manner.  The disrespect from this company’s owner came in the form of talking down to other board members and owners via email, hanging up on our board president during a phone call, and skipping a yearly board meeting to go to Tuscaloosa when he knew the main purpose of it was to get specific answers from him about the problems we were having as a property.  Fortunately, we’ve found another management company that doesn’t give us any of these problems and we are just beginning to recover financially.  I hope this review will help other people avoid the same problems and stress we had as property owners.

resp.text: Hello Andrew. Can you please give me some feedback on what caused the 1 star review?

name: Christopher Renda
text: Terrible Communication. It is physically impossible to get in touch with anyone. I honestly would like to find out how to get out of this Property Management Group without having to move from my home as we love it here. You will receive letters in the mail for changes to policy and/or violations and when you try to follow up you will receive no response. As a first time homeowner, this seems to be a very poorly managed HOA and I hope that all Home owners association groups do not operate in this way.

resp.text: Christopher: I apologize for the inconvenience you may have experienced. Please call the office and let me know how I can help personally.

name: John Higginbotham
text: First; I will update this review if it triggers a retaliatory response from this company. This company does not care about people. I say this from an experience I have had during this Covid-19 pandemic. After being laid off, this company refused to waive a late fee of $50.00 and an “admin” fee of $25.00 for its HOA fee assessment from not paying on time. Under normal circumstances, this would be expected, however, during a pandemic, you would think a company would be a little more understanding and naturally help those affected by this virus. This is why people dislike HOA companies. They seemed to be filled with hateful people that just want to make someone’s life hard because they are unhappy. Tread carefully when looking at properties run by Southern Property Management.

resp.text: Hey John. The manager was instructed, by your board of directors, not to waive the late fees. We ultimately take our directions from them in these cases, but we did ask on your behalf.

name: Jordan Johnson
text: Southern Property manages our condo association. I've owned several condos throughout my life and I've never experienced the kind of inept, rude interactions that I've had with SP and Kim. Especially considering what we pay, I wish we would switch to a different company.

resp.text: Jordan: You're not listed in any of our records as being a homeowner in any of our properties. Please call the office if you are truly an owner or tenant.

text: Our HOA has been a customer for over 3 years. They are quick, reliable and do an excellent job. We are very happy with our property manager. She replies almost instantly to any request and is proactive. Using them has been a big time saver and is money well spent. .

text: Worst communication and management I’ve ever encountered for an HOA. I have emailed Danielle, and have literally left her 5 plus voicemails regarding installing our fence at our home. When they do answer the phone, it’s a gentleman that offers no answers but just connects me to Danielle’s supposed line, where I continue to fill up her voicemail box. I am not sure she even exists since I have heard nothing from her or the company.

resp.text:

I apologize for the inconvenience this has caused but her actions aren’t typical for us, in fact, she no longer works with us.

Please contact me directly and I’ll help you.

Barrett

name: Jim Brandt
text: Our HOA has used this company for years. We have enjoyed our relationship with them. They are professional, responsive and proactive. They removed much of the day to day responsibility from the Board Of Directors. There research into selecting new vendors has been spot on. They oversee the collection of dues, maintain of finances and anything else the BOD requests. Using Southern Property Management Group is money well spent. I highly recommend them.

name: Ron Kilgo
text: Great communication!  They’re always helpful in returning documents and providing the information requested in a timely manner.  I would highly recommend Southern Property Management Group to any HOA property searching for an excellent management company.

name: Selenia Dunst
text: Probably the worst company I've ever dealt with. Paid 195$ a month for them to never answer the phone or return phone calls. I can think of literally one occasion out of the three years I've been here that they have returned a phone call. Forget about answering the phone. According to the bylaws this company was responsible for outside maintence to our condos and would only mow the grass when multiple people voiced complaints. Multiple times we've seen snakes laying around where our dogs and children play. They removed the only dumpster available to the community and then told us to stop dumping our trash there. According to the bylaws, this company was responsible for half the cost of window replacements. While our windows were long overdue we could never get a response back from them for the three years we've tried to get them to comply. Even so, the few windows on the street that were replaced were sub standard. I'm so happy that another company has taken over the management of these condos, hopefully things will change for the better.

name: Ginny Waller
text: OK on promises, but very poor on follow up. Currently 3 weeks late on providing a check for services. " we have had a change in our accounting department" four times but still no check. Suggest all avoid this firm.

name: Simon Ranagan
text:
I found Dave on accident while looking for a place to stay on super short notice.  Not only did he personally call me to ensure everything went smoothly with renting, he continued to be personally involved in my stay, routinely checking to make sure I had everything I needed and was comfortable.  The few times I had any issues, like a small incident with the city dumping tree trimmings where I would park, he was super responsive and helpful in resolving the issue almost immediately.

The house itself was great and the location was super convenient.  It was a less than 10 minute drive to downtown, grocery stores, and the mall by exit ten, but also a quiet enough neighborhood that I could feel at home at the end of my day.  It was also a two block walk to Lakebottom Park, which really can't be beat.

Probably the best part of my experience with renting from Dave though, was that he is 100% serious about looking out for people who have rented from him.  While moving to a new duty station, I contacted him asking if he wouldn't mind being a reference on a lease application.  He had the reference forms filled out and sent back to me just a couple hours later.  He is seriously awesome.

If I'm every back in the Columbus area again, he is the first person I would contact to rent from, without hesitation.

resp.text: It was my pleasure to host you Simon, good luck to you with everything. -Dave

name: Jason Ryu
text:
Do not expect to get your security deposit back. RW does not protect tenant's security deposit.
They let my landlord withdraw my security deposit, without giving me any contact or information about deduction, even after, I contact them more than 15 times and it all happens after I go through moving out inspection and evict.
I requested refund or the evidence of maintenance which I'm obviously not responsible(Can't even tell it really happend), every single email or call I make them, gave me the same answer(check posted photo).
So basically, if you rent place through this company, land lord can make up some reasons after you evict, and before you receive your security deposit, they can simply withdraw it without your authorization, and just ghost you, wonderful experience!

resp.text: The property owner determines any and all charges that are assessed during the move out. Our disposition manager spoke with you after you had concerns with the charges that the property owner assessed. You provided our office your written dispute of the security deposit. The disposition manager was able to send your dispute to the homeowner for their determination. Upon review, the property owner feels the amounts withheld are justified and no adjustments will be made. This is the property owner’s final decision and, unfortunately, there is no further action that Renters Warehouse can take on your behalf in regards to this dispute.

resp.text: Hilary, our apologies for the delay in our response. Due to the COVID-19 situation, Google delayed publishing user reviews and are now gradually publishing these reviews, thank you for your patience. I am sorry to hear that you experienced these issues. Your lease began on April 1st. On April 6th you contacted us with complaints about the smell of mold and the condition of the water heater. We considered this to be an emergency case and immediately contacted the homeowner. A vendor was approved to visit the property. Upon inspection the tech found no odor that would be related to organic matter. The home was in need of a good cleaning but there were no visible signs of organic matter as well. The water heater was unable to be checked due to no power being on in the home, the tech did check for leaks and found none in its current state. Other issues throughout the home were noted and included in an estimate, the owner approved for all repairs to be made at your earliest convenience. You refused to schedule with the vendor and requested to terminate the lease. The owner approved your request on April 15th, we are currently in the process of closing your account. If you have any questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948, we will be happy to assist.

text: 1st account manager scammed my tenant out of a $950 deposit that should've gone to me. After firing him I was assured the money would be refunded after the eviction was completed. After months of following up I never received the deposit.

resp.text: Hello Miles, you had a tenant placed in the home on 2/8/2018 and they were evicted from the home on 10/4/2018. After they were required to vacate the premises the disposition was proceeded with. The charges assessed to the past tenant exceeded the security deposit funds. The security deposit totaling $950.00 was to be sent to you as the homeowner. However, this balance was applied towards the outstanding balances on your account. The following charges on your account were the following; $55.00 for an estimate fee, management fees from June - October, and a portion of your re-keying of the property. Please be advised, their is still a balance owed on your account for this re-key of the property. Please submit a payment for this outstanding balance on your account. If you have additional questions please contact our office at 844-793-4948 and we will be happy to assist you.

text: Donna was great!  During a very short beach vacation my husband and I decided to purchase a condo and was referred to Donna by a family friend. Donna is extremely knowledgeable about the area and understood what we were looking for.  I had declined to look at one specific property and thankfully she talked us into taking a look. We absolutely LOVED IT and ended up purchasing the condo.  Donna's professionalism and responsiveness is top notch.  She walked us through the process of putting a contract on the property and went above and beyond as not one but TWO hurricanes came through the area while we were waiting to close and take ownership.  She even drove over to the property after the first hurricane and sent us pictures.  We live 4 hours away but with Donna there locally we never felt the distance.  I would recommend Donna to everyone, she gets to know you and listens to what you want and are looking for.  Without her I feel we would have settled for a property we did not totally love.  I can't thank her enough. With her guidance the entire process went smoothly and we are extremely happy owners of a beautiful condo in Perdido Key, FL.

text: This is not a true "Listed it Myself" program.  The listing is under an agent in Huntsville, who is not attentive or professional in the way she deals with  her "Listed it Myself " clients.

resp.text:
This is Bobby DeHaye, the owner of Listed It Myself.

First and foremost, customer satisfaction is the foundation of our business.  It is never OK with me if anyone associated with our business is treating, or even gives the perception of treating our customers unprofessionally.   That will be dealt with immediately.  In addition, I have added my personal cell phone number to our Contact page so if anyone ever has any issues at all, they can call me directly instead of letting any frustration about the process build to a breaking point as it appears happened here.

To address another point in your review, my company, Listed It Myself, LLC, is incorporated in Huntsville.  My wife Christy and I also live in Huntsville.  For the MLS portion of our services, it is necessary to have a real estate brokerage.  In Huntsville, our brokerage is ListedItMyself Real Estate Group, LLC, and here in Birmingham, our partnered broker is Legacy Home Realty.  We have tried to be as transparent on this arrangement as possible on our website through our blog post https://listeditmyself.com/huge-improvements-to-our-mls-listing-service-option/ and I have also inserted additional links to this information on our FAQ page and our How It Works page.  Either way, if a customer has a problem in Huntsville or Birmingham, they can call me directly and I will work to resolve whatever the issue may be.

In the more than five years we have been in business, we have taken pride in the fact that we have helped hundreds of very happy customers successfully sell their homes and collectively save millions of dollars in traditional real estate commission.  I know that the hard work that Brandon Harder here in our Birmingham area puts in to marketing these homes is a key factor to their many successes.  Because I know how hard he works for our customers, it makes a review like this more difficult to swallow.  But as our core values state “…if something is not right, we fix it.”…so that is exactly what we’ve done.  We appreciate you bringing the issues with your experience to our attention…that allows us to learn and continuously improve.

Ms. Pare,
As Broker of our company I take great pride in promoting professionalism by all of our Realtors.

I apologize for the fact you feel you were not treated properly in a recent real estate negotiation. Seeing as you were not a direct client of our office but working through another Realtor in purchasing one of our listings I think some things were lost in translation and probably could have been handled more tactfully.

I have spoken with Viki Yaron and she realizes some of the negotiation could have been better handled speaking directly with your Realtor in order to explain her client’s counteroffer. Please feel free to call me anytime at our office if you like to discuss further.

Stacey Sanders, Broker

text: Great folks- would highly recommend working with them.  They represent lots of good properties.

name: Jackson Pearson
text: I could not possibly agree more with the negative comments that I've read on here. I've lived in three of Bradford's properties over the last 10 years and have only positive things to say about them.  They're open Monday-Friday 9-5, just like their website says they are.  I will say that I've called within those hours and had to leave a message before but they've always called me back.  They have an email address for emergency maintenance which they've always been responsive to as far as I am concerned at least.  The people who work there are always polite and helpful.  I've had issues with bugs in the past as well but they sent an exterminator over for an extra spray a couple of times between the regular monthly spray and the issue was taken care of.  The guys who do their maintenance seem very nice.  They've surely never been rude or disrespectful.  I've had a couple of situations where they came to fix something and didn't have all of the parts the needed, so they had to leave and come back- once even hey had to order a part and it didn't come until the next day, but they seem to be qualified and have always made repairs that meet my standards.   I've surely never been made to feel as if they don't care about me or my issues.  I see them at least once per month to pay rents. I always have a delightful conversation with Jenny who works the front desk.  She is always kind to ask about my family and my life.  This business is very community oriented and involved in most every event that goes on in Montevallo.  I always see that they've sponsored little league and parades and festival and food drives.  I just can't imagine anything than that the people who have left negative comments created negative situations for themselves.  I'd even go so far as to say that this company goes above and beyond for their tenants.  Josh even came by to check on my heater one year on thanksgiving night because it had been giving me some issues that week.  anyone that is going to come out after hours and on a holiday just to make sure my family and I aren't cold is ok by me.  I'd give these people 10 stars if it was an option.

text: Applied for a rental house with a co-signer that was within my price range, paid the application fee, only for them to waste 3 day of my time after being told my the agent that there should be no problem getting approved. I constantly felt an air of discrimination from the front desk secretary. multiple times I was refused to speak with my agent. I was quoted a timeframe of 12 hours, it has been 3 days and they refuse to work with me. This company has lied to me, wasted my time, and now put me at a severe disadvantage with less than 24 hours to find a place to go. Gina is overall unpleasant to work with and Josh refuses to speak with clients. The power of approval is in a single mans hands (josh). there is no regulated system, but seemingly approving or denying basred of opinions of the person. the entire time I felt I was being pushed away and like they were trying to keep me out. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU GIVE THIS COMPANY YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Ouida Brackett
text: I called to deal with an issue of the company putting a check through on my account that was post dated. When I initially asked the front desk clerk if it would be okay to pay my 1st months rent,  and since I was there, give her a check for the upcoming months rent. I don't live in Montevallo and the property I was renting was in Alabaster. So since you can't pay rent online, I gave the post dated check so that I wouldn't have to drive back to Montevallo. I was assured TWICE by the clerk that this was okay. Fast forward after I paid my initial deposit as well as first month's rent. They decided to also deposit my post dated check for the upcoming month. Leaving me with an NSF due to the fact that the postdated amount wasn't accounted for in my monthly budget. ESPECIALLY after you already received $2,000 from me within a weeks time. I called and spoke with JOSH who verbally assaulted me and basically called me a criminal for writing bad checks. After he informed me that it's not their policy to take a post dated check and he doesn't know where I got that info from. I LITERALLY GOT IT FROM THE FRONT DESK  CLERK!!!! HE took no ownership, did not apologize, complained about a $50 fee he would have to pay b/c of my returned check and then hung up in my face. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that the check cleared on my end. My bank LITERALLY cleared the check and just charged me an NSF fee. All I wanted was my $30 back. He didn't even have the human decency to listen to what I was telling him before becoming beligerent!! This company is the absolute worst that I have ever dealt with in my life. And my husband is military so we have moved and dealt with numerous companies. RUN...DON'T WALK AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!

name: Jansen Arceneaux

Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. Also they do not do electronic payments!!! This is the 21st century Bradford!! Try and keep up 😉

text: Great Company!!

name: Patrick Nelson
text:
I think the pictures below pretty much speak to the quality you can expect from Woodland.  I've have tried calling their sales office, I was told to call corporate, I called corporate and got voicemail.

My house is about 4 years old.  Well out of warranty.  But, most of the poor workmanship appears after the warranty period has ended.  My master bath and entrance to our master bedroom has severe structural problems.  The cracks you see have been re-plastered and painted more than once.  Forget about doors closing properly.  The doors have been trimmed to such an extent that a new door will be required for the bedroom.  The framing issues you may have will not be covered by your warranty and will not appear until a few years after you own your home.  Once they do, you will find yourself spending a lot of money to repair.

If framing were the only issue, I probably would not write the review.  I never do this kind of thing.  But the electrical was done so poorly that it nearly burned the house down.  The left exposes copper to aluminum high voltage line exposed in a junction box.  The result was blowing out the double oven's control panel.  This resulted in an expensive repair to the ovens, but could have easily resulted in a fire.   Again-- the kind of thing that happens well after your warranty period has expired.

The problem I have with Woodland, is that their "quality" is only skin deep.  They have a great marketing staff, but once your in your house and a year has passed you are on your own to deal with the poor workmanship that lies just below the surface.  No builder is perfect.  But, it would be nice if they built to code.  I have more pictures if you are interested.

name: Joy Wink
text: We love Woodland Home! This is our second home purchase with them. They were professional and very organized through our home building experience. Thank you so much Woodland Homes Team! You are the best!

resp.text: We are so happy that you enjoyed your experience with us!

name: Blake
text:
Let it be known that I’ve given Woodland over a year and a half to make themselves better before writing this review and they have continued to be just as much of a disappointment as they were since the day we closed.

First, don’t let them convince you to close and that your outstanding items will get fixed within 30 days. The sub-contractors don’t keep up with their warranty repairs and Woodland doesn’t follow-up with you after closing unless you are constantly in contact with them. Check my review of Custom Interior Trim to see just how their subs act and treat customers.

Their warranty team is an absolute joke. They don’t follow-up, they don’t coordinate, and if you aren’t keeping them in line, they just let your items slide off the radar.

They have shown a complete lack of professionalism ever since we closed. I will admit, we love the house itself. It’s good quality, the design process was fun, and we felt like the options they had to choose from were exactly in line with what we wanted, but the worst mistake I ever made was trusting that they would continue their great service after having closed on the house. If you don’t listen to anything else, just hear me when I say do NOT let them close on your house until they finish everything. It has truly been bad enough that I regret ever choosing them as a builder, no matter how much we do like the house itself.

And again, if I’m being completely honest, the staff that they have are nice people. I mean I have legitimately enjoyed dealing with most of their staff, but I’ve also had to do their job for them. I have to do all of the follow-up to make sure people are showing up to do their warranty repairs. I’ve had to coordinate with the warranty department and the subs to make sure they had all of the correction items listed.

It’s exhausting dealing with Woodland and their lack of support for Warranty customers. I’ve told them this multiple times, but if they would put just as much care into how they treat and deal with Warranty customers as they do with new customers still in the building process, they would be a nearly flawless business. Until then, they deserve this negative review and more. I’ve spoken with multiple people in my neighborhood who can corroborate this story and would say the same thing themselves. We have warned people we know away from Woodland specifically because of this and away from some of the specific sub contractors they use. Horrible customer service, dismal professionalism, and a demeanor that says “you as a customer don’t matter to us as much as the new build customers.”

resp.text:
Blake,

Thank you for the kind words regarding your home building experience with Woodland Homes. We are happy to hear that you had a fun experience and enjoyed our process of building. Next, we would like to say that we understand your frustrations with warranty. We are in fact struggling with time lines and subcontractors. At this time North Alabama and surrounding areas are experiencing a housing boom. This combined with the struggles of building a product in the midst’s of a global pandemic have made it difficult to obtain products for some of our customers warranty requests.

It is also difficult to keep subs motivated when they have so much work to choose from in front of them. This is just the honest truth, and the reality of the world we are living in.  That said we understand it is frustrating to wait on your items to be completed. While it may take us a little longer to complete a warranty item we are getting to all of our customers and completing their warranty requests. In fact, we have even extended specific warrantable items past the agreed upon 1 year term in order to ensure our customers are happy, and have their items completed .

Since we don’t know your full name there is no way to reach out directly. We would encourage you to call your onsite sales person and get them involved to assist you, or even call our corporate office and ask for the president of the company. He will be happy to work directly with you.

name: Dina Boley
text: Woodland Homes was outstanding building our home!  We loved the out of town service we received when buying from West coast.  The staff helped us every step of the way!  We love our beautiful home.  We couldn’t be happier!

name: Aisha Buycks Realtor (Huntsville Madison AL)
text:
Woodland Homes is a local builder who builds beautiful neighborhoods and homes. They are generally in a nature rich area and provide green spaces within their communities. Most neighborhoods start at mid $300K and go up. There may be a few neighborhoods available at a lower point.

Their process is pretty easy and they are Realtor friendly. Pretty much anything you could want they have the ability to make it happen. You are not limited on your customization as long as you don't price yourself out the neighborhood.

They offer a variety of available styles homes such as garden homes, townhouses, craftsmen bungalows, traditional style homes. Their level of quality in any home they build is generally Executive level. The offer and array of floorplans and amenities within their communities.

If you are in need of someone to assist you while navigating your purchase process with Woodland I am definitely available to help. You can click on my name to acquire my contact.

name: Matt Curtis
text: As an owner of a Woodland Home, Shayne Templet was very helpful in getting us information on our home to help us with a remodel. Thanks Shayne!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We really appreciate it!

name: Dominic Simard
text: They built us our dream home!  Love the home, love the people, and love the company! Our 4,650 sqft home is quality.  No major issues.  True luxury home!  Lived in the home for over a year now.

resp.text: Dominic, thank you for letting us know! We are honored to have built your dream home. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do.

name: Cathy Olive
text: Working with Morgan on our house closing was a pleasure. She is very professional and kept us fully informed.  So far we are pleased with the overall craftsmanship and also enjoy the neighborhood.

name: Disappointed Home Buyer
text: The initial phase of the home buying process was great. The personnel in the home office were welcoming and professional. During the build I hired a home inspector who found major errors with the home. This information was relayed to the site manager and many of the errors were overlooked and I’m still dealing with them. Upon walking through my home I found basic issues with the craftsmanship that should’ve been addressed by the site manager, if he had completed a walk thru of the home. Once the home was complete a final walk thru was scheduled. I found the same issues as the last walk thru. At this point, if you don’t address the problem it’s often overlooked. I refused to sign for the keys. As a buyer I felt rushed to sign for the keys to the home, that wasn’t ready. I was promised the issues would be addressed in a timely manner, “I’M STILL WAITING”. I still have a page of outstanding issues with my home. As a premier builder I expected more. The subcontractors provided poor quality of work. No disrespect, but the attention to detail lacked, for my home. I hope no one has to go through what I did. I’m not sure if it’s due to the number of homes Woodland is trying to build or is this the standard issue with Woodland across the board. I didn’t want to come off as a complainer, so I asked around my neighborhood and many of us shared the same problems. This is not to bash Woodland. The homes, cosmetically looks great, I think more effort needs to be made to build a better quality home for the price and oversight of the subcontractors is a must. If this doesn’t happen hold the site manager accountable. The warranty department shouldn’t make people feel like they are the problem. The subcontractors need to do their job and provide a quality product. If I had to do it all again I would definitely ask around the neighborhood where I’m buying and meet one on one with the builder. The company should accommodate, people are spending a lot of money on these homes.

resp.text: Hello, thank you for your feedback. We pride ourselves in our builders and customer service. If you would please call our office directly, we can address any of your concerns or questions directly. We are sorry to hear this but look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you again.

name: Vinson Moore
text: I have looked at Woodland Homes on Green Mountain, Huntsville Al. It actually defies logic that I could desire so much to live there, be impressed with what I saw, and have the experiences I have had. Maybe it is coincidence but I don’t think so. I will simply state what happened and let the reader decide. I have seriously looked at Woodland homes 4 times. The first experience was positive but I was afraid of the road in and out of the area so I decided not to buy. The last 3 times I had resolved that fear and wanted to purchase a house from Woodland homes. The first of these three, I spoke with an associate. He showed me a lot and gave me a price for a home on the lot. He said we had to see his boss. I did so and she literally panicked. She said he gave me the wrong price. I said ok and left. The second of these 3 times, Woodland homes sent me an email with an advertisement for a house already built. It was priced in the range we were looking for. We made an appointment with the aforementioned realtor and spent 30 minutes looking at the home. It had one feature we did not like but we were about to make an offer when she said oh no, this house has been sold. She added, but we can build you one like it on another lot. We spent a couple of hours looking at lots and found 3 we liked. She said she would send us the prices on all three. The result was that the lot we wanted was not available for the house we wanted to build on it and the other two had prices that were 40 to 50 thousand dollars more than the one we looked at. Not exactly the same price...The last time my wife met with a different realtor and got prices for several models one of which was built and the other almost completed. You have probably guessed what happened. I showed up with the checkbook only to find that all of the homes with quoted prices were much higher than documented on the plans provided to my wife. The one we really wanted was about $70,000 more. The other home already built was about 40,000 dollars more than documented on the plans.We left and will not return. The neighborhood looks great and maybe our experience is some kind of odd anomaly. Just wanted to share it. Good luck.

name: Anthony Shipp
text:
Just had a house built by them, The build to approximately one year due to weather restrictions. But that is not what this is about. The outside of the house is nice and for the most part the inside is ok.

However there are issues with the house that need to be addressed and my mother who has been handling the build for me since I can not be present can not get a hold of anyone. No call backs and no email back.

We are almost certain the HVAC is not connected in the office, the ladder into the attic is not painted or spackled so it is just bare wood, my mother had to paint the trim around the fireplace, and there is a window that still hasn't been installed. The back yard landscaping is terrible, there are so many ruts and holes in the grass that you can barely walk without something to hold onto. The front yard isn't much better.

I could understand a production builder but I would not have expected this from a company that supposed to be a premium builder. The attention to detail is lacking. An expensive production builder.

Update: 28 Jan 2020

Attic stairs still not finished and also realized that the bottom piece of molding is missing from master bathroom window. Also adjacent lots sold to another builder possibly bringing down the property value in existing homes.

I would never recommend building with Woodland and definitely will not consider if I have another home built in the future.

resp.text:
Thank you for your response. We have been in consistent contact with your mom through-out this process. We apologize that communication has been difficult with you since you have been out of country. This is the first we have heard of the HVAC problem, but we have now reported it our warranty department.
It is also not uncommon for a brand new yard of sod to have slight dips after being freshly installed. We are confident that your yard meets warranty guidelines, however, when you return and visit your home we will be happy to look it over again.
Lastly, our records indicate multiple email & phone traffic between the designated POC & the Woodland Homes team.
*Woodland homes appreciates all custom feedback. We are committed to offering a quality home with a one-year warranty in which all terms and conditions are clearly laid out at time of purchase*

name: James Ashbaugh
text: Woodland Homes has made our new home buying experience so seamless, personal, and enjoyable. Thanks to Shanye, John, Rayford, and the whole Woodland Team for all they’ve done to make this transition so great!

name: Tim F
text:
Been in the house as the original owner 6 years, have had multiple issues due to poor subcontractor work.  When a general contractor (Woodland) consistently picks poor subs and refuses to stand behind them, it makes me wonder how they can stay in business as long as they have.

We’ve had plumbing issues with the shower fixtures, roof leaks around the fireplace, and electrical issues with outlets that came loose from the wall.

The most recent is a completely preventable HVAC issue.  The coil sprung a leak after 6 years.  The sub neglected to register the unit, so instead of a 10 year warranty, the manufacturer only gives a five year warranty.  The bill is $2,000 thanks to the sub’s laziness.

Corners were cut at every turn leaving me to wonder what will fail next.  Very disappointed with Woodland, their choice of subs, and lack of accountability.  👎🏻

name: Kim Skaff
text:
Woodland Homes builds a beautiful home on the outside.  However, if you are looking for top quality and attention to detail, you would be better off with another builder. They build homes quickly - maybe too quickly as evidenced by some of the problems we have experienced.  After living in our home for two years, a light switch in our dining room which was not in use at the time suddenly sparked and popped and caused a breaker to blow.  I called an electrician who discovered that the wiring was barely connected which caused arcing and sparking.  He then checked a few more light switches and outlets to find that about half of them were loose and sloppily constructed.  I ended up paying for the electrician to inspect every light switch and electrical plug in my home. I have also had to replace wiring in the electrical box because of a humming noise.
When you build a home with Woodland, they schedule you for a one day marathon of dealing with the contract staff and their design team.  You must be prepared to make ALL decisions in one day.  Their design center has a limited number of choices and you have no time to research products. Don't assume that they offer quality products, either.  Price Pfister products were their plumbing choice at the time I built my home. Huge mistake.  If I had known how crappy this brand was, I would have insisted on Delta products. That goes for wood floors also.  I chose a "premium" product for an additional cost only to find after it started denting and scratching immediately that it was made out of a soft eucalyptus based engineered wood.  I have already replaced half of it with a nice Hickory engineered wood that has held up beautifully- even in high traffic.
I was not happy with either their ceramic tile selection or carpet choices but had no option other than to pick what I disliked the least.  Apparently, most of my neighbors did the same because we all have the same back splash.  I have already replaced carpeting in my bedroom because of poor wear.
This is not the first home that I have had built so it is not like I was expecting perfection.  However, it was expecting better quality than I received.

After speaking with someone at Woodland about the leak in my Chimney I was told to contact the people they use to install these but Woodland would not pay for it. At this I asked why and was told "if we fix yours and word gets out we will have to fix everyone's". I now have damage in one bedroom and all my insulation is wet.

name: FLhogs n dogs
text:
False advertising on listings.  Unethical.  Posting houses active that are under contract, etc.  Entire matter filed with Alabama Association of Realtors.

Standard of Practice 12-8
The obligation to present a true picture in representations to the public includes information presented, provided, or displayed on REALTORS®’ websites. REALTORS® shall use reasonable efforts to ensure that information on their websites is current. When it becomes apparent that information on a REALTOR®’s website is no longer current or accurate, REALTORS® shall promptly take corrective action. (Adopted 1/07)

resp.text: ValleyMLS, of which this company is a member, requires that all listings that go under contact reflect that status change within 24 hours of ratification of such contract. This company adheres to the policy of the ValleyMLS.

text: I did not choose to work with anyone from this inconsistent office but had no choice after one of their realtors bought the property I live in from rocket city property management. My rent was always due by the 6th well they changed that and did not tell me then tried to charge me 50$ extra for Jan Feb and March claiming I was late but they just took too long to deposit my checks. NOT AT ANY POINT IN TIME WAS I CONTACTED AND MADE AWARE OF ANY LATE CHARGES. I HAD TO FIND THE INFORMATION ON MY ONLINE PORTAL MYSELF 3 months later and I never got a formal letter stating that I owe anything. If you owe a business, arent they supposed to send you a letter or written notice? They are so unprofessional because not only did I get ZERO letters, in the lease it stated I was to pay 45$ for late fee not 50$ so someone is not able to ensure things are consistent in this office anymore. I would not recommend dealing with this office whatsoever. They raised my rent and took three weeks to stop a huge rain water leak I had coming through my ceiling, and let me go without a working fridge for nearly a week while leaving two fridges in the tiny apartment for two weeks for storage not able to use either one. It has just been a ridiculous experience I am hoping there is a still a decent place to rent from in this area but so far this place has done me wrong totally I got two babies under 2.  Can’t afford unnecessary extra charges, rent going up, and not having a fridge. Just ridiculous and sad. I cannot wait to move.

resp.text: Kyrie,  we are so sorry this has been your experience and we would like to be able to look into your complaint.  We don't have anyone by your name registered as a tenant in our Property Management Division.
